title.narrative: Kyrgyzstan: Commercial Mediation in the Kyrgyz Republic (Phase 2): COVID-19 Response

description.narrative: The project aims to assist the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic with promoting and facilitating the use of commercial mediation to small and medium enterprises (SMEs), specifically during and post the COVID-19 pandemic period, with the goal of making the use of mediation, including online mediation, a business norm in the Kyrgyz Republic.

1) To introduce online mediation for efficient resolving of commercial disputes during and post the COVID-19 period and make mediators a viable alternative to courts. 2) To strengthen capacity building of key players (such as mediators and judges) on online commercial mediation to encourage them to refer mediable disputes to mediation. 3) To involve the business community, in particular SMEs, by means of a targeted mediation awareness raising campaign and piloting mediation.

Direct beneficiaries: The Supreme Court of the Kyrgyz Republic (SC), the High Justice Training Centre (HJTC) under the SC, the Republican Community of Mediators of the Kyrgyz Republic (RCM) and Mediation Centers, Kyrgyz mediators and SMEs.
